title: Ciarran Stott reveals gay past to Angie Kent on The Bachelorette
text:
He's the British heartthrob who famously twerked for Angie Kent during The Bachelorette's first cocktail party.

And Ciarran Stott, 25, finally spoke about exactly where he learned his raunchy moves during Wednesday's episode.

Enjoying some intimate one-on-one time with the 29-year-old, Ciarran revealed his raunchy past as a dancer, explaining: 'I used to dance in a gay bar.., with, like, drag queens.'

Say what? 'I used to dance in a gay bar.., with, like, drag queens,' Ciarran (left) admitted to the Angie (right) on Wednesday night's episode of The Bachelorette

'It was carnage, but it was so much fun!' he mused.

Angie was understandably tempted to deep dive for more on Wednesday's night's episode of The Bachelor.

'What other little secret things do you do?' she probed.

Chuckles galore: Angie was understandably tempted to deep dive for more after Ciarran's stunning confession

'I had a nose job last year,' he responded. 'I was proper self-conscious about it.

'Well, it's a nice-looking nose now,' replied the bubbly blonde.

'It should be for the money that I paid for it,' he laughed.

And then what happened? 'What other little secret things do you do?' Angie probed.

Nothing to sniff at: 'I had a nose job last year,' Ciarran confessed to Angie.

He then went on to explain: 'I got a nose job because I hated my side profile. So I got it all trimmed down and looking nice and schmick... the ladies love it now.'

Angie was clearly enamored by the lovable larrikin.

'I think you're lovely. So I wanted to know, Ciarran, if you would accept this rose?'

Awww: 'I think you're lovely. So I wanted to know, Ciarran, if you would accept this rose?' Angie asked.

The former Army rifleman is proving to be one of the most colourful characters on The Bachelorette this season.

The Manchester-born reality star is also no stranger to the spotlight.

In 2016, Ciarran regularly performed on stage in skimpy underwear alongside drag queens at Darwin's leading gay nightclub, Throb.

Elsa, where are you? Ciarran (left) is certainly no stranger to the spotlight, with a raunchy past performing in Darwin's leading gay nightclub, Throb

He even starred in a Christmas show called 'Camp Christmas: Freezn', which was inspired by the Disney movie Frozen.

'He's not gay but has always been the centre of attention and loved being up on the stage,' a friend of Ciarran's has told Daily Mail Australia.

Another insider said he 'only worked at Throb for a few months' but has performed as a dancer at other venues across the Northern Territory.

The Bachelorette continues Wednesday at 7:30pm on Channel Ten
description: He's the British heartthrob who famously twerked for Angie Kent during The Bachelorette's first cocktail party.
authors: Shannon Shipley For Daily Mail Australia
